p:
The Saenz Model [ 28] requires 12 parameters and was designed to fit experimental in vivo data from horses [ 6, 7]. The model contains eight variables and 12 reactions ( Figure 11a). There are no adaptive immune response, no dead cells, and no natural killer cells. However, the model contains viruses V and interferon F. There is an eclipse phase (
E 1
and
E 2
) here as well as prerefractory and refractory cells. In particular, epithelial cells are represented by six species: susceptible ( T), eclipse phases (
E 1
and
E 2
), infectious ( I), prerefractory ( W), and refractory ( R). Thus, the new features are the inclusion of two eclipse phases and three steps for the transformation of uninfected cells to refractory cells.
